title: So is Twitch in a good state?
body: Since he is not being considered for the Marksmen Update on the upcoming preseason changes.

replies.body:
There'll be a bunch of smaller changes to marksmen other than the 6 listed in preseason as well. In Twitch's case we're looking at a CD reset on his Q when a champion affected by his passive dies plus some clean up around stealth (entering stealth now cancels current attack orders to avoid immediate screwage, R breaks stealth on attack launch instead of when the spell's first pressed, giving a bit less response time). 

On top of that there are also some significant item changes to marksmen items coming too, some of which should be pretty appealing on Twitch (Ghostblade changes for example that include it gaining increased AD).

My group jokes about the state he's in now. No he's not an all-around terrible champ, but his weaknesses and strengths are so odd. It feels like his stealth puts him in the niche of a marksman/assassin, and stealth being a mechanic that Riot seems to never be happy with makes him even more of a problem. He has two steroids that allow him to burst down entire teams alone if fed, but his other basic abilities and passive feel underwhelming mechanically and numerically. His ranged assassin playstyle means that Riot has to give him low early game numbers, and his stealth means that he has to reserve a certain lack of counterplay. It's incredibly difficult in Twitch's current state to get fed, and since his items only increase his strength as much as one would expect for an adc, his role in a team is "be an adc that people won't expect coming as he tries to 1v1 people", even though there are adcs that specialize in burst and dueling that would be able to take him out in an even fight.

That being said, I personally hate supporting Twitch because laning phase I never expect to get any kills as he cant whittle people down with any worthwhile poke, and the strength of his Q + ult isn't enough to 2v2 two full health opponents. His slow isn't as reliable as I'd like it to be for someone with low mobility either. It feels very much like his strategy is just to farm, despite there being marksmen like Vayne and co. who scale far better with farm and are still able to kill in lane.
Yeah I think Twitch really needs a full rework into a more cohesive kit.  I'm thinking not really Sion level rework, but maybe like Ryze level.

Twitch isn't really that scary late game. He lacks a lot of things a late game hypercarry has and unless he's fed he doesn't really do anything. His passive with 6 stacks, taking the full duration, at the passive's max rank does 216 true damage though this damage is also lowered if you take in consideration health regen and a health potion pretty much removes the passive off you.

An ADC with trashy AD steroids, almost no utility, almost no mobility, and one of the worst if not the worst early games can't really be considered scary late game or at all. Just play Vayne she's a viable Twitch.

He can single handily win a teamfight though by capitalizing on poor positioning and works well in wombo combo comps that can lock a team down since AoE crits are AoE along with his rather high damage expunge. I am not saying he is good by any means but he DOES have his uses since he is also one of the few adcs than can roam early and get a kill if he goes undetected.

But why pick Twitch for Expunge when Kalista's Rend can do infinitely more damage than Twitch's?

And if you want a wombo combo champ, with the new buffs to MFs ult it does a ton of damage. Even Graves' ult is better for a wombo combo comp than Twitch's, because the enemy have to stand in a straight line. On top of that they take reduced damage, not that Twitch's E or passive do much to begin with.

Honesty Twitch as a champion from looking at his kit looks well rounded but he feels like Quinn in her CURRENT state. An ADC that just doesn't bring enough of anything to the table to be viable outside of a top lane bruiser, even pro Twitch players like Sneaky can't pull Twitch off and usually just feed so It's not like It's just bad players who don't understand Twitch.

But you don't pick Twitch for Expunge. Expunge is just a tool that helps him with what you pick him for - picking off targets out of position, whether it be through stealth and steroids in the midgame or through AOE in late game teamfights.

Specifically, Expunge helps with midgame assassinations.

Then what do you pick Twitch for?

True damage? Vayne is better.
Teamfighting? Miss Fortune is better.
Dueling? Sivir is better.
CC? Ashe is better.
Poke? Corki is better.


If you want to pick off targets out of position you definitely came to the wrong role because that's not what ADCs do and the ones that have been remarkably good at it (current Vayne, pre-rework Twitch) were extremely unbalanced. Even then why pick an ADC if you need to assassinate people, I can assure you there's plenty of both ranged and melee champions that can do it better and safer.

Vayne also happens to be one of the best ADC duelists (Sivir would fit better as a teamfighter and hard engage)

Twitch can apply all of his autoattacks in a very large area (Kalista is limited by Runaan's, which affects only the closest enemies + her main target)

A fed, well positioned and protected Twitch can absolutely wipe entire teams from super long range. 
Problem is, he's difficult to get a lead on, and many assassins can just say screw your positioning, I'm on top of you.
Twitch is the most vulnerable ADC. Every other AD has a form of hard mobility, hard cc or up front burst to threaten assassins with. ''Hard'' in this case means reliable, and the Rat is the opposite, meaning he's a champ with some of the highest damage potential, but he's not dependable. And what is time and again at the forefront of the viability meta? Reliable champions.
